summary.overview: The Number To Words Converter application allows users to input numeric values and receive their word representation in real-time. It provides immediate feedback on input validity and displays conversion results directly on the page.
summary.predefined_options: The application uses predefined arrays for digit names, tens, ties, and denominations to standardize the conversion process and ensure consistent output.
summary.external_resources: The application uses external resources such as stylesheets (styles.css) for styling and JavaScript files (script.js) for functionality.
summary.external_js_libraries: No external JavaScript libraries are used; the application relies on custom JavaScript code for its functionality.

requirements.description: Context: User accesses the application. User Action: User views the main title. System Response: The application displays the heading 'Number To Words Conversion' at the top of the page.

Context: User wants to convert a number to words. User Action: User enters a numeric value into the input field. System Response: The application validates the input and displays the word representation of the number in the output paragraph.

Context: User enters non-numeric characters into the input field. User Action: User types invalid characters. System Response: The application displays an error message 'Invalid input. Please enter only digits.' in red text in the output paragraph.

Context: User enters a number longer than 15 digits. User Action: User types a large number. System Response: The application displays an error message 'Too Large Number.' in red text in the output paragraph.

Context: User enters a valid numeric input. User Action: User types a number within the valid range. System Response: The application converts the number to words and displays the result in black text in the output paragraph.
Context: User enters the number zero. User Action: User types '0'. System Response: The application displays 'Zero' in the output paragraph.
Context: User interacts with the input field. User Action: User types or deletes characters. System Response: The application dynamically updates the output paragraph based on the current input.
